poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: That skulk-in-the-grass with the rattling neck Would up and crack my nose with its skelfy haft. My nose! Next it's inscribing isobars In gravel courts where they rake in oxblood leaves That the monsoon squanders. 'I would like to spend two months', says Beckett, 'In the country, digging holes, Filling up each one as I go With the earth from the next'.
